alert.note: Alert for Fannin; Murray; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 9:28PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Murray, Whitfield and northwestern Fannin Counties through 1000 PM EST... At 927 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Red Clay S.p. to near Tunnel Hill to near Noble, and moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Dalton, Chatsworth, Varnell, Eton, Tunnel Hill, Cohutta, Crandall, Sumac, Jones Mill, Rocky Face, Gregory, Cohutta Wilderness, Conasauga Lake, Tennga, Beaverdale, Dawnville, Cisco and Colwell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
